SET THE SCENE.Definition: gave the background information before the main story

TUMULTUOUS.Definition: full of trouble, chaos, or loud action

HUMID.Definition: warm and wet in the air

STIFLING.Definition: very hot and hard to breathe

FROM ALL WALKS OF LIFE.Definition: from many different types or jobs

RIPPED THROUGH.Definition: moved through with great force and caused damage

OVERTURNED.Definition: flipped upside down or onto their side

EYEWITNESS.Definition: someone who saw the event happen

WAILS.Definition: loud cries of sadness or pain

RUBBLE.Definition: broken pieces of the destroyed building

DISTINCTION.Definition: a special mark or fact that made it different

CLASHES.Definition: fights or violent meetings between groups

STRIKING A BLOW AGAINST.Definition: harming or attacking it to weaken it

ISOLATED.Definition: alone or cut off from others

PUBLIC SYMPATHY.Definition: feeling of support or understanding from the general public

SCARRED.Definition: hurt in a way that left long-lasting pain or fear

FACTIONS.Definition: smaller groups inside a larger group

PENSIONERS.Definition: people who were retired and received a pension

PARTISAN.Definition: someone who had fought against fascists in Italy during WWII

FUNERALS.Definition: ceremonies held to bury the bodies

DEPRESSINGLY.Definition: sadly; in a way that makes you feel unhappy

FINGERPRINTS.Definition: signs or marks of their actions

MISHANDLED.Definition: managed badly or done in the wrong way

SUSPECTS.Definition: people who might have done a crime

ON DAY RELEASE.Definition: allowed to leave prison during the day but return at night

MAINTAINED THEIR INNOCENCE.Definition: kept saying they did not do it

RABBIT HOLE.Definition: a confusing set of ideas that is hard to escape from

PLANTED.Definition: secretly put somewhere to trick people

INTIMIDATED.Definition: frightened so they would not speak or act

PARANOID.Definition: unreasonably or obsessively suspicious or mistrustful

SCENT.Definition: a trail or clue they followed

PAWNS.Definition: people used by others without knowing it

IN CUSTODY.Definition: kept in prison or by the police

SENTENCED.Definition: officially given a punishment in court

APPEALS.Definition: requests to change a court decision

VERDICTS.Definition: final decisions made by the court

SCARS.Definition: long-lasting marks from hurt or pain

WARPED.Definition: strange or twisted in a wrong way

HAUNTING.Definition: sad and unforgettable in a troubling way
